授業目的: 本講義では学生が英語でコミュニケーションを取るための基本的な日常会話の語彙・文 法を修得することと、話す(発表する)技術の向上を目的としている。
特記事項: 【合併】英語IIｂ　１９（経済学部）/英語IIIｂ　１９（経済学部）
授業方法:
Lecture: Faculty members explain the details of knowledge. Basically, the main learning activity for students is to take notes of the explanations made by faculty members and from videos of Academic talks. However, these are followed by question-and-answer sessions between faculty members and students.

Writing: Students perform ten Free Writing exercises (10 minutes, no dictionary required) in-class using Google Classroom/LUNA/Blackboard. Students write about a wide range of interesting topics and after submission, they read and comment on their classmates’ writing.

Pair work: Students perform learning activities in pairs such as discussion, dictation, and peer feedback and evaluation.

Group work: Students make groups of three members or more to perform learning activities such as discussion, surveying, and interviewing.

Presentation: Students summarize the results of their own learning activities and present them to a partner; first as an in-class rehearsal, and then students select a topic for a short Poster Presentation. Each semester has two Poster Presentations in Sessions 5 & 13.

Assessment: Session 6 is the Mid-term test and Session 14 is the End-of-term test. Students read passages and questions related to the covered textbook units and choose from multiple choice answers. Students also write a 100-word mini-presentation script. The test does not require speaking or listening.

Assignment for next Session preparation - Textbook Homework: Students prepare for the next class by reviewing the textbook’s covered content, previewing upcoming contents, and completing assigned textbook tasks. Students handwrite answers and upload photos of their answers to Google Classroom/LUNA/Blackboard.

Assignment for next Session preparation - Online LMS Homework: After registering with the ABAX LMS Talking Point 1 website, students complete assigned tasks. Task types consist of Vocabulary Matching or Recorded Speaking

Workshop: Students begin to plan and design the A4 poster for the Poster Presentations class. This is conducted in the last 30 minutes of Sessions 4 & 12, featuring tutorials and design feedback from the instructor.
